body.p: p. 1.- The Greek population of America can't understand just what the PAnhellenic Union stands for. They have a misguided notion that it means quarrels, arguments, petty jealousies, graft, politics, etc. Our contention is, that if the Greek population would stop looking for faults and see only the good qualities of their fellow nationals, our problem would be solved.

As soon as an organization becomes systemized, large, and strong, the Greeks begin to fear it. The only reason for this is because they are jealous. They resent the leadership of one man, whether it be good or bad leadership.

The Panhellenic Union was considered a marvelous institution, of great help to the Greeks of America. Handled properly it could be of the greatest possible benefit to them. But they, being Greeks, wish to
destroy it as soon as possible. The only thing we can tell these strong-willed people is "Live and Learn and Regret."
